result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard Junior Jackson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Richard Junior Jackson in court.  Attorney Colin Patrick McGinn in court for Richard Junior Jackson.  Attorney Francesco Mineo in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Defense counsel informs court that they have received discovery materials, but are still awaiting an offer from the State. Court adjourns matter for a status conference date to Br 16.
Status conference scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Richard Junior Jackson appeared by video.  Attorney Colin Patrick McGinn appeared by video for Richard Junior Jackson.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer D. Whittenberger. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Court enters a not guilty plea on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Branch 16.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
State Public Defender - Order Appointing Counsel received and filed.  bm

Defendant Richard Junior Jackson in court in person.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests that the matter be set for a State V. Lee hearing or status; denied. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
  No possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription.

Defendant Richard Junior Jackson in court with attorney Jane Jerman.  Defendant Richard Junior Jackson in custody.  Sarah Mackenzie Dahdouh appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
